title: [$500] iOS - Notificiation - New messages are not shown until user is online after selecting notification

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @adelekennedy (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @cubuspl42 (`External`)

Proposal for Issue #31765: iOS - Notification - New Messages Not Displayed Until Online After Selecting Notification
Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
In the iOS version of the app, when a user receives a push notification for a new message, selecting the notification does not display the new message until the user reconnects to the internet. This happens when the app was previously closed and the device is offline at the time of selecting the notification.

What is the root cause of that problem?
The issue likely stems from the app's handling of push notifications and local data synchronization when offline. The push notification handler (index.native.js) might not be updating the relevant Onyx keys (like ONYXKEYS.NETWORK) to reflect the arrival of new messages when offline. Additionally, there might be gaps in how the app manages AppState transitions and utilizes cached data in Expensify.js.

What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
To address this issue, several modifications are proposed:

Update Push Notification Logic: Enhance the push notification handling in index.native.js to ensure that relevant Onyx keys are updated properly when a notification is received, regardless of the online/offline status.
Optimize Onyx Local Storage Usage: Revise local storage handling to ensure that new messages are cached and retrieved effectively when the app is launched from a notification while offline.
Improve AppState Transition Management: In Expensify.js, refine the management of AppState transitions to check and update the UI with new messages when the app resumes from a notification.
Synchronize Messages with Session Data: Guarantee that session data (ONYXKEYS.SESSION) is correctly maintained or restored, especially for syncing messages related to the session.
Implement Offline Feedback: Utilize OfflineIndicator.js and OfflineWithFeedback.js to provide immediate feedback on the message's offline status and display messages correctly in offline mode.
What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
N/A

By implementing these changes, we can ensure that the app correctly displays new messages when opened from a notification, even in offline scenarios. This approach aims to enhance the user experience by addressing the core issues related to push notification handling and data synchronization in offline mode.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.2-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Login in primary and secondary device as User A and User B respectively. 2. Close app on primary device and send message to User A using the secondary device 3. After User A receives notification, disconnect device from internet 4. Wait 10 seconds and double tap on notification received on primary device ## Expected Result: App opens to chat and new message is seen ## Actual Result: App opens to chat and new message is not displayed until user reconnects to internet ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/34783dbc-896a-48d3-8424-b954324d5859 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
